articles.author: Divya Rajagopal
articles.description: A handful of Canadian, German and Australian critical mineral explorers plan to command premium prices for key metals used in electric vehicles, promising quality and consistency in exchange for shifting reliance away from China, the dominant producer and price-setter.
articles.title: Focus: Western miners seek premium pricing for rare earth metals to break China grip

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese authorities have asked Ping An Insurance Group to take a controlling stake in embattled Country Garden (2007.HK), the nation's biggest private property developer, four people familiar with the plan said.
articles.title: Exclusive: China authorities ask Ping An to take controlling stake in Country Garden, sources say

articles.author: Shankar Ramakrishnan
articles.description: Private lenders, in pole position as high interest rates leave them as the sole option for many in the commercial real estate market (CRE), are turning more selective and worsening a liquidity gridlock in a sector facing trillions of dollars of maturing debt.
articles.title: Liquidity gridlock worsens in US commercial real estate sector

articles.author: Dietrich Knauth
articles.description: WeWork will make its first U.S. bankruptcy court appearance on Wednesday, seeking to advance a restructuring proposal that could cut $3 billion in debt and shrink the company's real estate footprint.
articles.title: WeWork seeks permission to begin canceling leases in bankruptcy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Economic policy shift in China and the investment opportunities it is creating are drivers for long-term bets in the country by global asset managers, top executives said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Global asset managers bullish on China after policy shift

articles.author: Nivedita Balu
articles.description: As Canada's economy enters a period of sluggish growth, the big banks are looking to fortify their balance sheets against rising bad debts, but instead of tapping shareholders for funds, the lenders are expected to sell non-core assets and cap dividends, fund managers and analysts said.
articles.title: As bad debts soar, Canadian banks eye asset sales to boost capital

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maytaal Angel
articles.description: Israel's ground forces in the Gaza Strip aimed on Wednesday to locate and disable Hamas militants' vast tunnel network beneath the enclave, the next phase in an Israeli offensive that has killed thousands of Palestinians.
articles.title: Israel targets Hamas tunnels after encircling Gaza City

articles.author: Joseph Ax
articles.description: Polls began closing on Tuesday in eastern Kentucky, where the state's gubernatorial contest was among several U.S. elections offering critical clues about where the electorate stands ahead of the 2024 presidential election.
articles.title: First US polls close as contests in Ohio, Virginia offer preview of 2024

articles.author: Kate Abnett, Gloria Dickie
articles.description: This year is "virtually certain" to be the warmest in 125,000 years, European Union scientists said on Wednesday, after data showed last month was the world's hottest October in that period.
articles.title: This year 'virtually certain' to be warmest in 125,000 years, EU scientists say
